column2: MT DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Montana

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn

column2: 2. You are driving on a four-lane divided highway, two vehicles are driving side by side ahead of you, and you are in a hurry. You should:
column4: drive closely behind the vehicle in the left lane and flash your headlights.
column6: drive in either lane with at least a two-second time interval behind the vehicle ahead.
column8: drive closely behind the vehicle in the right lane.
column10: drive closely behind the vehicles ahead changing lanes frequently.

column2: 3. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column4: Always.
column6: by slowing down and making sure they are being seen by pedestrians.
column10: when pedestrians are crossing within a marked or unmarked crosswalk.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Merging traffic ahead
column8: Pass only in the right lane
column10: Cars in right lane must slow down

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right

column2: 6. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.

column2: 7. When a vehicle is hydroplaning:
column4: the tires lose contact with the road surface.
column6: the spray from large trucks reduces visibility.
column8: the windshield wipers cannot keep the windshield clear of rain.

column2: 8. Drivers must not drive at:
column4: a speed that is greater than the posted speed limit.
column6: a speed that is not prudent for the circumstances.
column8: a speed that is greater than reasonable.

column2: 9. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: cross the tracks.
column10: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 10. When you are involved in an accident, you should:
column4: help the injured.

column2: 11. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.
column10: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 12. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 13. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column10: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 14. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 15. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: others drive below the speed limit.
column6: you are on a four lane road.
column8: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column10: anything makes conditions less than perfect.

column2: 16. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 17. A flashing yellow light:
column4: is used at dangerous intersections.
column6: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column8: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 18. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you should:
column4: immediately come to a complete stop.
column6: slow down, provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.
column8: disregard the signal if there are other lanes available for the emergency vehicle.
column10: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.

column2: 19. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 20. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column6: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 21. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 22. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______Â of your vehicle.
column4: only in back
column10: only on the left and right side

column2: 23. This sign means drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column8: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.
column10: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.

column2: 24. This sign means:
column4: No parking on pavement.

column2: 25. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column10: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 26. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Diamond

column2: 27. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: reaction speed

column2: 28. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column4: rectangle shaped.

column2: 29. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column4: either side

column2: 30. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: accelerate much faster

column2: 31. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column8: on the left shoulder of the road.

column2: 32. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column4: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 33. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column4: Service signs

column2: 31. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column8: on the left shoulder of the road.

column2: 32. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column4: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 33. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column4: Service signs
